intro: Trembleya parviflora subsp. heterostemon, commonly known as the narrow-leaved trembleya, is a flowering plant native to South America, particularly Brazil. It is a member of the Apocynaceae family, which includes milkweeds and related plants. The species is characterized by its slender, erect stems and small, clustered flowers that are typically white or pink in color. Its leaves are narrow and opposite, and the plant often grows in moist, shaded environments. The subspecies heterostemon is distinguished by its unique floral structure, including distinctively shaped stamens.
